workflow.name: Automate email & calendar management with Gmail, Google Calendar & GPT-4o AI
workflow.description:
Boost your productivity with this AI-powered email and calendar assistant:

This AI-powered template has 2 workflows. It manages your Gmail inbox and Google Calendar, classifies emails with custom labels, and suggests replies and meeting times ‚Äî all fully automated with OpenAI and n8n.


Automatically analyze your Gmail inbox

Suggest replies, priorities, and meeting times

Checks your Google Calendar for conflicts and free slots

Maintain conversation context using Thread History Vector Store

The agent proactively acts using a Tools Agent architecture, with integrated memory and real-time tool invocation. It's perfect for busy professionals who want a personal assistant for communication and scheduling.

Included features:

‚úÖ Do actions on incoming mails 8like Labeling etc)
‚úÖ Summarize and Assist fot the latest emails
‚úÖ Draft replies and schedule meetings contextually
‚úÖ Handle time zone conversion and MessageID referencing
‚úÖ Context retention of last conversation history - using VectorStore

üì¶ Requirements:

Gmail + Google Calendar credentials via n8n credentials

OpenAI API key

n8n VectorStore nodes (or external integration like Pinecone, Qdrant, or Chroma)

parameters.limit: ={{ $fromAI("limit", "The maximal number of mails to receive.", "number") }}
parameters.toolDescription: Consume the Gmail API to get the last emails
Consume Google Calendar API to receive a list of calendar events between "start" and "end". Make sure to pass datetime.

nodes.name: Code - Summarize Email Thread as Text

parameters.toolDescription: Call the Gmail API to delete an email. Always request the email message id before calling this tool.

nodes.name: Create an Email Draft as response to a thread

parameters.message: ={{ $fromAI('Message', `The Text that should be send in reply`, 'string') }}

options.threadId: ={{ $fromAI('thread-ID', `The ID of the thread. Need to be received from the Email Tool Response. Use the exact ID and better call the Get Email Tool again`, 'string') }}

parameters.subject: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('Subject', ``, 'string') }}
parameters.toolDescription: Call Gmail API to create a Draft message as Reply To an existing email or email thread. Pass the correct Thread-Id of the message. To get the Thread ID call the Get Email Tool before.

parameters.message: ={{ $fromAI('Message', `The Text that should be send in reply`, 'string') }}
parameters.subject: ={{ $fromAI('Subject', ``, 'string') }}
parameters.toolDescription: Call Gmail API to create a New outgoing Draft message.
Consume Google Calendar API to add a new event or meeting to the calender
Consume the Gmail API to receive an email by message-id

nodes.name: Research context and infos in previous conversations

parameters.description:
Can answer questions and do research in previous email conversations. Use this tool whenever you need more context about past conversations to an email. 
For better retrieval and more context always pass the email-adresses to the query!

options.systemMessage:
=# AI Assistant Prompt ‚Äì Inbox & Calendar

## Role  
You are my personal AI assistant for email and calendar management.  
I am Daniel P√∂tzinger, CTO of AOE.  
You support me in organizing my Gmail inbox, keeping track of important topics, handling emails, and managing appointments efficiently.  
You provide suggestions and analyses, and act autonomously when retrieving information using the available tools.

---

## Scope  
You analyze emails and calendar data, identify relevant information, prioritize, and assist in processing.  
You can access email content, draft responses, suggest calendar entries, and identify available time slots ‚Äì based on the tools provided. Use the tools proactively.

> Today is `{{ $now }}` in timezone +2.  
> The user is in timezone +2.

---

## Command

- Regularly provide an overview of current and prioritized emails.  
- Detect requests, invitations, or to-dos in emails and suggest appropriate actions or scheduling.  
- Propose meaningful draft replies suitable to the context.  
- Monitor the calendar for upcoming appointments, conflicts, or free time slots.  
- Suggest daily or weekly structures based on calendar availability.  
- Support planning and coordination directly from the context of emails.  
- When suggesting appointments, always check availability in the calendar.  
- Note that calendar timestamps are in UTC and must be converted before evaluation and display.  
- When handling emails and using the corresponding tools, remember the `MessageID` so it can be passed to other tools.  
  Always show the `MessageID` to the user so it remains accessible in your conversation history.

---

## Format

- Clear, structured presentation of suggestions (e.g., lists, tables, bullet points).  
- Draft replies must always be **friendly and professional** ‚Äì respectful, clear, without unnecessary phrasing.  
- Calendar and time suggestions must be easy to read (e.g., ‚Äúnext Tuesday at 2:00 PM‚Äù).

---

## Constraints

- Only send emails or create appointments after confirmation from the user.  
- Always act in the spirit of **relief, clarity, and efficiency**.

categories.description: any email from colleagues with the sender @example.com
Every email with an existing contact in the CRM or that sounds like a customer.|Also mails that sound like a customer inquiry and mails that show a project reference.

parameters.content:
## Main Inbox Assistance Agent

### Before Using
** Modify the classifier agent for your needs. Add the Labels in GMail before, if you want to assign labels.
** Add proper credentials
** Modify the Prompts (e.g. give more context about your role and company)

### More on professional Agents:
** From [AOE AI Lab](https://ai-radar.aoe.com/)

user.bio:
We are AOE‚Äôs AI & Automation Team ‚Äì engineers, architects, and AI specialists.
We build production-ready, agent-based automation using n8n, LLMs, vector stores, and secure toolchains.
Our focus: ideation, evaluation-driven development, and scalable AI architecture.
All workflows are modular, reusable, and built for real-world application ‚Äì by practitioners
